intro: Cyrtandra lysiosepala var. ewartii, commonly known as the Warted Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, wart-like tubercles on its stems and leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
